textgoal: Make a list with three elements
defines: ['function get(a, i) { return 0;}','function fold(f, a, init) { return 0;}','function slice(array, begin, end) { return 0;}','function set(a, i, value) { return 0;}', 'function map(f, a) { return a; }', 'function length(a) { return 0; }','function concat(left,right) { return a; }']

textgoal: lists can have lists as elements
We can see if a list has no items with the isEmpty function.
defines: ['function isEmpty(list) { return  (length(list)) == (0); }','function head(list) { return get(list, 0); }','function tail(list) {length(list) == 1 ? [] : slice(list, 1, length(list)); }','function cons(item,list) { return concat([item], list); }','function reverse(list) { (length(list) < 2) ? list : concat(reverse(tail(list)), [head(list)]) }']

textgoal: We can use the head function to get the first item in a list.
"We can use the tail function to get everything except the head."
We can access every item in a list by using just the head and tail functions.
We can add new items into an old list using the cons function to build a new list. Try building the lists below.
Build a the list below starting with an empty list using the cons function.
Try to build the list below.
We can reverse lists using the reverse() function.
We can add a value to the end of a list by using reverse() and cons().
Great! Now that we can add an item to the end of a list, let's wrap that up as a function called addToEnd().
